element.name: Inferior Mesenteric Ganglion
element.notes: S1-S4, single - not paired, unpaired visceral arteries

element.name: Pterygopalatine Ganglion
element.comments: from SSL parasympathetic, to nasal (smelling and moisturing) and palatine (create antibodies, immunity booster) glands

element.name: Intralaryngeal Peripheral Ganglion
element.function: parasympathetic motor of larynx, c.n. X
element.notes: macroscopic ganglion on the human internal laryngeal nerve, with the distribution of its post-ganglionic fibres to the glands in the saccule and to the glands at the root of epiglottis in the vicinity of the opening of the saccule

element.name: Pelvic Peripheral Ganglion
element.function: Sigmoid, rectum, bladder, and external genitalia

element.name: Myenteric Ganglion
element.notes: ganglion is outer neural layer around stomach

element.name: Submucosal Gut Ganglion
element.function: Controls gastrointestinal secretion and local blood flow
element.notes: ganglion is inner neural layer around stomach

element.name: Trigeminal Ganglion
element.function: Integration of external auditory meatus (auricular branch), cranial meninges (meningeal branch), and external surface of tympanic membrane
element.notes: sensory fibers of ophthalmic, maxillary, mandibular nerves to principal trigeminal nucleus

element.name: Jugular Ganglion
element.function: Integration of external auditory meatus (auricular branch), cranial meninges (meningeal branch), and external surface of tympanic membrane
element.comments: CN X, superior ganglion of vagus nerve

element.name: Petrosal Ganglion
element.function: Integration of afferent signaling from viscera
element.comments: CN IX, superior and inferior ganglia of glossopharyngeal nerve, Hering's nerve
element.notes: mucous membranes of pharynx, middle ear, carotid body and sinus, taste sensor on the posterior third of tongue to SOL

element.name: Nodose Ganglion
element.function: Integration of afferent signaling from viscera
element.comments: CN X, inferior ganglion of vagus nerve
element.notes: caudal SOL - larynx, trachea, gut, and aortic arch receptors; rostral SOL - taste receptors of posterior oral cavity

element.name: Spiral Ganglion
element.notes: Fibres from bipolar cells in the spiral ganglion consist of peripheral branches that end in the organ of Corti and central branches that end in the ventral and dorsal cochlear nuclei

element.name: Vestibular Ganglion
element.function: transform vestibular (balance) information into body coords

element.name: Dorsal Root Ganglion
element.function: Integration of afferent signaling from viscera
element.notes: Sensory nerves project to upper thoracic dorsal horn via dorsal root ganglia

element.name: Upper Cervical Dorsal Root Ganglia
element.function: Integration of afferent signaling from meningles, head, neck

element.name: Lower Cervical Dorsal Root Ganglia
element.function: Integration of afferent signaling from shoulder, arms

element.name: Upper Thoracic Dorsal Root Ganglia
element.function: Integration of afferent signaling from visceral heart
element.notes: Sensory nerves project to upper thoracic dorsal horn via dorsal root ganglia
